stories.text: I saw a clear trend in recent years. Almost every software is using purple color for its branding and main themes. While I'm not against the color itself, the sheep mentality of UI designers (if it was their decision), to blindly copy a single color, appears silly. Let me be honest - the color looks nice only when used for things in the foreground, and looks pretty ugly if you pour it all over a webpage or software.
stories.title: Why is purple color taking over the world?

stories.text:
Did you that people still need groceries even when the economy is trash? Did you know that retail/supply chain tech is super interesting from a security standpoint and includes questions like “how do we stop autonomous forklifts from rising up?”

We’ve got quite a few roles open:

Sr. AppSec Eng: https://eofd.fa.us6.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1001/job/138032/?utm_medium=jobshare
